definition: race course/race ground/race track
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: So the hippodrome is the circus in Latin.
sentences.chinese: 所以賽馬場就是拉丁語中的馬戲表演場。

sentences.english: The stewards will inspect the course to see if racing is possible.
sentences.chinese: 那些幹事將檢視賽馬場看是否適宜比賽。

sentences.english: You're already at Churchill Downs to watch the horse race.
sentences.chinese: 你已經在丘吉爾唐斯賽馬場觀看賽馬了。

sentences.english: There is the members' enclosure at the racecourse.
sentences.chinese: 那兒是這個賽馬場上的會員座區。

sentences.english: Han Jia, it can't be the racecourse here.
sentences.chinese: 韓佳，這裏不會是賽馬場吧。

sentences.english: So much for racetracks on Hainan.
sentences.chinese: 看來，海南是不會開賽馬場了。

sentences.english: He had been thinking all the time of his "pull" with the race-track magnates.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在想着他和賽馬場那些巨頭們的交情。

sentences.english: China travel, Inner Mongolia, Horqin, a racetrack. Photo by KaKa.
sentences.chinese: 中國旅遊，內蒙古，科爾沁，一個賽馬場。

sentences.english: In former days there was a racecourse here.
"Baby Stripes" finally had a chance to compete with other horses on the racetrack.
sentences.chinese: “小斑”終於有機會馳騁於賽馬場上爲夢想飛奔。

sentences.english: My house backs onto the racecourse.
sentences.chinese: 我家房子後面與賽馬場爲鄰。

sentences.english: The match was held on a small hill.
sentences.chinese: 賽馬場地是一個小山丘，綠草如茵。

sentences.english: This is only one of the racecourses in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 香港的賽馬場不止一個。

definition: apartment building/CL:座[zuo4]
Kai Tak Airport, international airport of Hong Kong from 1925 to 1998
skyscraper/CL:座[zuo4]
World Expo/abbr. to 世博[Shi4 bo2]
textile factory/cotton mill
semicolon (punct.)
World Trade Center

definition: cotton mill/textile factory
financial district
Nananqu district of central Chongqing municipality, formerly in Sichuan
Zixing county level city in Chenzhou 郴州[Chen1 zhou1], Hunan
Taichung or Taizhong county in central Taiwan
Revive China Society, founded by Dr Sun Yat-sen 孫中山|孙中山 in 1894 in Honolulu
office building
